verses.verse: O ye children<WH1121> of Benjamin,<WH1144> gather yourselves to flee<WH5756> out of the midst<WH4480> <WH7130> of Jerusalem,<WH3389> and blow<WH8628> the trumpet<WH7782> in Tekoa,<WH8620> and set up<WH5375> a sign of fire<WH4864> in<WH5921> Beth-haccerem:<WH1021> for<WH3588> evil<WH7451> appeareth<WH8259> out of the north,<WH4480> <WH6828> and great<WH1419> destruction.<WH7667>
I have likened<WH1819> the daughter<WH1323> of Zion<WH6726> to a comely<WH5000> and delicate<WH6026> woman.

The shepherds<WH7462> with their flocks<WH5739> shall come<WH935> unto<WH413> her; they shall pitch<WH8628> their tents<WH168> against<WH5921> her round about;<WH5439> they shall feed<WH7462> every one<WH376> in<WH854> his place.<WH3027>

Prepare <WH6942> ye war<WH4421> against<WH5921> her; arise,<WH6965> and let us go up<WH5927> at noon.<WH6672> Woe<WH188> unto us! for<WH3588> the day<WH3117> goeth away,<WH6437> for<WH3588> the shadows<WH6752> of the evening<WH6153> are stretched out.<WH5186>
Arise, <WH6965> and let us go<WH5927> by night,<WH3915> and let us destroy<WH7843> her palaces.<WH759>

For <WH3588> thus<WH3541> hath the LORD<WH3068> of hosts<WH6635> said,<WH559> Hew ye down<WH3772> trees,<WH6097> and cast<WH8210> a mount<WH5550> against<WH5921> Jerusalem:<WH3389> this<WH1931> is the city<WH5892> to be visited;<WH6485> she is wholly<WH3605> oppression<WH6233> in the midst<WH7130> of her.

As a fountain<WH953> casteth out<WH6979> her waters,<WH4325> so<WH3651> she casteth<WH6979> out her wickedness:<WH7451> violence<WH2555> and spoil<WH7701> is heard<WH8085> in her; before<WH5921> <WH6440> me continually<WH8548> is grief<WH2483> and wounds.<WH4347>

Be thou instructed,<WH3256> O Jerusalem,<WH3389> lest<WH6435> my soul<WH5315> depart<WH3363> from<WH4480> thee; lest<WH6435> I make<WH7760> thee desolate,<WH8077> a land<WH776> not<WH3808> inhabited.<WH3427>

Thus <WH3541> saith<WH559> the LORD<WH3068> of hosts,<WH6635> They shall throughly glean<WH5953> <WH5953> the remnant<WH7611> of Israel<WH3478> as a vine:<WH1612> turn back<WH7725> thine hand<WH3027> as a grape gatherer<WH1219> into<WH5921> the baskets.<WH5552>

To <WH5921> whom<WH4310> shall I speak,<WH1696> and give warning,<WH5749> that they may hear?<WH8085> behold,<WH2009> their ear<WH241> is uncircumcised,<WH6189> and they cannot<WH3201> <WH3808> hearken:<WH7181> behold,<WH2009> the word<WH1697> of the LORD<WH3068> is<WH1961> unto them a reproach;<WH2781> they have no<WH3808> delight<WH2654> in it.

Therefore I am full<WH4392> of<WH854> the fury<WH2534> of the LORD;<WH3068> I am weary<WH3811> with holding<WH3557> in: I will pour it out<WH8210> upon<WH5921> the children<WH5768> abroad,<WH2351> and upon<WH5921> the assembly<WH5475> of young men<WH970> together:<WH3162> for<WH3588> even<WH1571> the husband<WH376> with<WH5973> the wife<WH802> shall be taken,<WH3920> the aged<WH2205> with<WH5973> him that is full<WH4390> of days.<WH3117>

And their houses<WH1004> shall be turned<WH5437> unto others,<WH312> with their fields<WH7704> and wives<WH802> together:<WH3162> for<WH3588> I will stretch out<WH5186> <WH853> my hand<WH3027> upon<WH5921> the inhabitants<WH3427> of the land,<WH776> saith<WH5002> the LORD.<WH3068>

For <WH3588> from the least<WH4480> <WH6996> of them even unto<WH5704> the greatest<WH1419> of them every one<WH3605> is given to<WH1214> covetousness;<WH1215> and from the prophet<WH4480> <WH5030> even unto<WH5704> the priest<WH3548> every one<WH3605> dealeth<WH6213> falsely.<WH8267>

They have healed<WH7495> also<WH853> the hurt<WH7667> of the daughter of my people<WH5971> slightly,<WH5921> <WH7043> saying,<WH559> Peace,<WH7965> peace;<WH7965> when there is no<WH369> peace.<WH7965>

Were they ashamed<WH954> when<WH3588> they had committed<WH6213> abomination?<WH8441> nay,<WH1571> they were not<WH3808> at all ashamed,<WH954> <WH954> neither<WH3808> could<WH3045> they blush:<WH3637> therefore<WH3651> they shall fall<WH5307> among them that fall:<WH5307> at the time<WH6256> that I visit<WH6485> them they shall be cast down,<WH3782> saith<WH559> the LORD.<WH3068>

Thus <WH3541> saith<WH559> the LORD,<WH3068> Stand<WH5975> ye in<WH5921> the ways,<WH1870> and see,<WH7200> and ask<WH7592> for the old<WH5769> paths,<WH5410> where<WH335> <WH2088> is the good<WH2896> way,<WH1870> and walk<WH1980> therein, and ye shall find<WH4672> rest<WH4771> for your souls.<WH5315> But they said,<WH559> We will not<WH3808> walk<WH1980> therein.
Also I set<WH6965> watchmen<WH6822> over<WH5921> you, saying, Hearken<WH7181> to the sound<WH6963> of the trumpet.<WH7782> But they said,<WH559> We will not<WH3808> hearken.<WH7181>
Therefore <WH3651> hear,<WH8085> ye nations,<WH1471> and know,<WH3045> O congregation,<WH5712> <WH853> what<WH834> is among them.

Hear, <WH8085> O earth:<WH776> behold,<WH2009> I<WH595> will bring<WH935> evil<WH7451> upon<WH413> this<WH2088> people,<WH5971> even the fruit<WH6529> of their thoughts,<WH4284> because<WH3588> they have not<WH3808> hearkened<WH7181> unto<WH5921> my words,<WH1697> nor to my law,<WH8451> but rejected<WH3988> it.

To what<WH4100> purpose<WH2088> cometh<WH935> there to me incense<WH3828> from Sheba,<WH4480> <WH7614> and the sweet<WH2896> cane<WH7070> from a far<WH4801> country?<WH4480> <WH776> your burnt offerings<WH5930> are not<WH3808> acceptable,<WH7522> nor<WH3808> your sacrifices<WH2077> sweet<WH6149> unto me.

Therefore <WH3651> thus<WH3541> saith<WH559> the LORD,<WH3068> Behold,<WH2009> I will lay<WH5414> stumblingblocks<WH4383> before<WH413> this<WH2088> people,<WH5971> and the fathers<WH1> and the sons<WH1121> together<WH3162> shall fall<WH3782> upon them; the neighbor<WH7934> and his friend<WH7453> shall perish.<WH6>

Thus <WH3541> saith<WH559> the LORD,<WH3068> Behold,<WH2009> a people<WH5971> cometh<WH935> from the north<WH6828> country,<WH4480> <WH776> and a great<WH1419> nation<WH1471> shall be raised<WH5782> from the sides<WH4480> <WH3411> of the earth.<WH776>

They shall lay hold<WH2388> on bow<WH7198> and spear;<WH3591> they<WH1931> are cruel,<WH394> and have no<WH3808> mercy;<WH7355> their voice<WH6963> roareth<WH1993> like the sea;<WH3220> and they ride<WH7392> upon<WH5921> horses,<WH5483> set in array<WH6186> as men<WH376> for war<WH4421> against<WH5921> thee, O daughter<WH1323> of Zion.<WH6726>
We have heard<WH8085> <WH853> the fame<WH8089> thereof: our hands<WH3027> wax feeble:<WH7503> anguish<WH6869> hath taken hold<WH2388> of us, and pain,<WH2427> as of a woman in travail.<WH3205>
Go not forth<WH408> <WH3318> into the field,<WH7704> nor<WH408> walk<WH1980> by the way;<WH1870> for<WH3588> the sword<WH2719> of the enemy<WH341> and fear<WH4032> is on every side.<WH4480> <WH5439>

O daughter<WH1323> of my people,<WH5971> gird<WH2296> thee with sackcloth,<WH8242> and wallow thyself<WH6428> in ashes:<WH665> make<WH6213> thee mourning,<WH60> as for an only son,<WH3173> most bitter<WH8563> lamentation:<WH4553> for<WH3588> the spoiler<WH7703> shall suddenly<WH6597> come<WH935> upon<WH5921> us.
I have set<WH5414> thee for a tower<WH969> and a fortress<WH4013> among my people,<WH5971> that thou mayest know<WH3045> and try<WH974> <WH853> their way.<WH1870>
They are all<WH3605> grievous<WH5493> revolters,<WH5637> walking<WH1980> with slanders:<WH7400> they are brass<WH5178> and iron;<WH1270> they<WH1992> are all<WH3605> corrupters.<WH7843>

The bellows<WH4647> are burned,<WH2787> the lead<WH5777> is consumed<WH8552> of the fire;<WH4480> <WH784> the founder<WH6884> melteth<WH6884> in vain:<WH7723> for the wicked<WH7451> are not<WH3808> plucked away.<WH5423>
Reprobate <WH3988> silver<WH3701> shall men call<WH7121> them, because<WH3588> the LORD<WH3068> hath rejected<WH3988> them.
